    public forum_body -> string (887) "<p>How can I build this elasticsearch query on Java.This is my query</p> <pr...
    $value[0]->forum_body
    <p>How can I build this elasticsearch query on Java.This is my query</p>
<pre class="language-markup"><code>{
    "query": {
        "bool": {
            "must_not": {
                "nested": {
                    "path": "myField",
                    "query": {
                        "exists": {
                            "field": "myField.id"
                        }
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    }
}</code></pre>
<p>My mapping like this:</p>
<pre class="language-markup"><code>"myField": {
   "type": "nested",
   "properties": {
      "id": {
         "type": "text",
         "fields": {
            "keyword": {
               "type": "keyword",
               "ignore_above": 256
            }
         }
      }
   }
}</code></pre>
<p>I trust recently work with elastic. So hope you guys help me</p>

    public forum_body -> string (1238) "<p>In my SWT Java app I often want to return information from inside a Displ...
    $value[5]->forum_body
    <p>In my SWT Java app I often want to return information from inside a Display.syncExec() call. The best way I've found so far to do this is:</p>
<pre class="lang-java s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-java"><span class="hljs-keyword">final</span> ArrayList<Integer> result = <span class="hljs-keyword">new</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">ArrayList</span><Integer>();
GUI.display().syncExec(<span class="hljs-keyword">new</span> <span class="hljs-title class_">Runnable</span>(){ <span class="hljs-keyword">public</span> <span class="hljs-keyword">void</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">run</span><span class="hljs-params">()</span> {
   <span class="hljs-type">MessageBox</span> <span class="hljs-variable">mb</span> <span class="hljs-operator">=</span> <span class="hljs-comment">/* ... */</span>;
    <span class="hljs-comment">/* set up messagebox */</span>
   result.add(mb.open());
}});
<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> (SWT.OK == result.get(<span class="hljs-number">0</span>)) { <span class="hljs-comment">/* ... */</span> }
</code></pre>
<p>I think this is allowed because ArrayList is thread-safe, but is there a better container I should be using, or an easier way altogether?</p>
    ⇄public forum_title -> string (56) "What's the best way to return variables from a syncExec?"
